page.title: 08THE LOBSTER SMACK INN
page.content: { The oldest pub on Canvey is called the Lobster Smack, and it's at the end of Haven Road, just by the sea wall. There is a car park outside and there are also tables and chairs where people may sit. The roof is covered by tiles, and is a different shape to normal pubs. The roof looks old, because it isn't exactly symmetrical, as modern roofs are. The walls on the outside are covered by wooden cladding, which makes the pub look old. The ceilings are old, and you can see the beams made of wood. It's also dark. The pub is there because it's just near Hole Haven, which has very deep water for big ships, so the sailors would use the inn for enjoying themselves. There was also some smuggling in this area.
